info.title: Gateway API Specification
info.description: This is an API specification that allows devices to upload data to GET Cloud and obtain existing information on GET Cloud.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

get.summary: Get indexes of existing history logs

200.description: Successfully getting the indexes of history log.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

get.summary: Get indexes of existing instant logs

200.description: Successfully getting the indexes of instant log.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

get.summary: Get indexes of existing event logs

200.description: Successfully getting the event of instant log.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

get.summary: Get indexes of existing bms cycle logs

200.description: Successfully getting the indexes of bms cycle log.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

get.summary: Get indexes of existing bms histogram logs

200.description: Successfully getting the indexes of bms histogram log.

get.summary: List all available gateway versions (DON'T USE)

200.description: Successfully returning the list of all available gateway versions.

get.summary: Get the latest gateway software version (DON'T USE)

200.description: Successfully returning the latest gateway software version.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: version is the gateway's version that is to be downloaded.

get.summary: Get the download path and hash (DON'T USE)

200.description: Successfully returning the detail of the requested gateway software version.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

get.description: Make an authenticated get request to this endpoint to signal that the device is up and running, without uploading any logs.

200.description: Successfully pinging the server.

get.description: Make an authenticated get request to this endpoint to signal that the gateway is up and running.

200.description: Successfully pinging the server.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

requestBody.description: The set of valid status fields depends on the type of device, as documented on the latestA00465document, or see the "Schema" section.

200.description: Successfully uploading the status log of the selected device.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

200.description: Successfully showing the status of the given device visible for the logged in user.

get.description: Get the latest configuration of a device

200.description: Successfully showing the configuration of the given device visible for the logged in user.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

requestBody.description: The set of valid configuration fields depends on the type of device, as documented on the latestA00465document, or see the "Schema" section.

200.description: Successfully uploading the history logs of the selected device.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

requestBody.description: The structure of this endpoint always consists of an array of "events", each of which element consists of index, timestamp, type, and values. The structure of values depends on the event type. For instance, in the alarm event, each array element in values contains code and active. In the parameterChanged event, each array element in values contains index, oldValue, and newValue. See "schema" for more info.

200.description: Successfully uploading the event log of the selected device.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

requestBody.description: The set of valid instant log fields depends on the type of device, as documented on the latestA00465document, or see the "Schema" section.

200.description: Successfully uploading the instant log of the selected device.

parameters.name: mui
parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

requestBody.description: See the Schema section to see the set of valid cycle log fields. This log always comes in pairs (two rows) from the device, charging row and discharging row. Instead of sending as two separate rows, this log sends one row for each pair. The index, cycle number, and cycle logs are always in the form of int32 array with two elements.

200.description: Successfully uploading the cycle logs of the selected BMS.

parameters.description: mui is the device's identifier, which could be either a MAC or an MUI.

38.description: The firmware type number, what kind of firmware is on the device [firmwareType]

39.description: The firmware version number, which version of the firmware type is on the device [firmwareVersion]

44.description: Amount of capacity left in the battery. [stateOfCharge] (in %)

51.description: The total remaining Ah available for the life time of the battery [ahLeft] (in Ah)

52.description: Days left until battery is considered as end of life. [timeLeft] (in Days)

53.description: Number of cycles where 25% or less of the battery capacity have been discharged. In order for the cycle to be counted at least 1Ah must have been discharged. [cycles2To25]

54.description: Number of cycles where 26-50% of the battery capacity have been discharged. In order for the cycle to be counted at least 1Ah must have been discharged. [cycles26To50]

55.description: Number of cycles where 51-80% of the battery capacity have been discharged. In order for the cycle to be counted at least 1Ah must have been discharged. [cycles51To80]

56.description: Number of cycles where 81-90% of the battery capacity have been discharged. In order for the cycle to be counted at least 1Ah must have been discharged. [cycles81To90]

57.description: Number of cycles where more than 90% of the battery capacity have been discharged. In order for the cycle to be counted at least 1Ah must have been discharged. [cyclesAbove90]

58.description: Number of charge cycles stopped before battery is fully charged. [StoppedCyles]

59.description: Cycles left in battery. Calculated as  Available cycles  Total cycle count. [cyclesLeft]

60.description: Total time spent discharging since reset of statistics. [totalDischargeTime] (in s)

61.description: Total number of Ah discharged since reset of statistics. [totalDischargeAh] (in Ah)

62.description: Total number of Wh discharged since reset of statistics. [totalDischargeWh] (in Wh)

63.description: Total time spent charging since reset of statistics. [totalChargeTime] (in s)

64.description: Total number of Ah charged since reset of statistics. [totalChargeAh] (in Ah)

65.description: Total number of Wh charged since reset of statistics. [totalChargeWh] (in Wh)

66.description: Total number of Wh charged from mains supply since reset of statistics. Calculated as Charged Wh total / Charging efficiency. [totalChargeWhAc] (in Wh)

67.description: Capacity discharged per 24 h in percent of the rated capacity. Calculated as an average of the last 7 days (BMU2 only). [ebUnits] (in %)

68.description: Number of History logs available in memory. [historyLogCount]

69.description: The index of the latest history log, logs are stored in a circular buffer. To read logs the index is needed. [historyLogIndex]

70.description: The timestamp of the last history log in POSIX format [historyLogDate]

71.description: Number of Event logs available in memory. [eventLogCount]

72.description: The index of the latest event log, logs are stored in a circular buffer [eventLogIndex]

73.description: Number of Instant logs available in memory. [instantLogCount]

74.description: The index of the latest instant log, logs are stored in a circular buffer [instantLogIndex]

128.description: The Timestamp of the last event log in POSIX format [eventLogDate]

5.description: Number of cells of the battery [cells]

6.description: Capacity in Ah of the battery [capacity] (in Ah)

24.description: Current drained from the battery during charging. [baseLoad] (in A)

25.description: Resistance in the cables between charger and battery. [cableResistance] (in )

19.description: Security code for second level security [securityCode2]

113.description: The scan for nodes interval [scanNetworkInterval] (in ms)

114.description: The collect data minimum interval [collectDataMinInterval] (in ms)

115.description: The collect data maximum interval [collectDataMaxInterval] (in ms)

124.description: If the debug logs is active [debugLog]

132.description: If the Ethernet IP address is static [ethernetStatic]

206.description: Assigned IP address of the ethernet gateway [ethernetGateway]

217.description: The network restrictions as "channel:pan ID" ex "11:22", "" if all [networkRestriction]

219.description: ISO 8601 extended timestamp for when device data is read [timestamp]

225.description: The node restrictions, the node to be focused on, "" if all [nodeRestriction]

247.description: CAN bus speed in bits per second [canBitRate] (in bps)

items.description:
The order below can be changed as long as it follows the order of the rows. The list of allowed Device Data Specification IDs are:
  * `127` - Array of active alarm codes [activeAlarms]
  * `129` - The name of the charging algorithm [algorithmName]
  * `130` - The version of the charging algorithm, can be NULL [algorithmVersion]
  * `133` - The start time of discharge in POSIX format, seconds since 1 Januari 1970 with local time offset [dischargeTimeStart]
  * `134` - The end time of discharge in POSIX format, seconds since 1 Januari 1970 with local time offset [dischargeTimeEnd]
  * `138` - Battery cell voltage, 60-90s before entering the discharge state. [dischargeVpcStart]
  * `139` - Battery cell voltage, 60-90s before entering charge state. [dischargeVpcEnd]
  * `140` - Minimum battery voltage per cell during discharge. [dischargeVpcMin]
  * `141` - State of charge at start of discharge. [dischargeStateOfChargeStart]
  * `142` - State of charge at end of discharge. [dischargeStateOfChargeEnd]
  * `143` - Battery temperature at discharge start time. [dischargeBatteryTemperatureStart]
  * `144` - Battery temperature at charge start time. [dischargeBatteryTemperatureEnd]
  * `145` - The maximum battery temperature being reached during discharge. [dischargeBatteryTemperatureMax]
  * `146` - The minimum battery temperature being reached during discharge. [dischargeBatteryTemperatureMin]
  * `147` - Number of Ah discharged between discharge start time and charge start time. [dischargeAh]
  * `148` - Number of Wh discharged between discharge start time and charge start time. [dischargeWh]
  * `149` - Ah discharged when current > 25 % of Battery capacity. [dischargeAhI25]
  * `150` - Discharge time when current > 25 % of Battery capacity. [dischargeTimeI25]
  * `151` - Ah discharged when 25%  I > 15% of Battery capacity. [dischargeAhI15]
  * `152` - Discharge time when 25%  I > 15 % of Battery capacity. [dischargeTimeI15]
  * `153` - Ah discharged when 15%  I > 0% of Battery capacity [dischargeAhI0]
  * `154` - Discharge time when 15%  I > 0 % of Battery capacity. [dischargeTimeI0]
  * `155` - Duration of current regeneration during discharge. [dischargeRegeneratingTime]
  * `156` - Number of Ah being regenerated between Discharge start time and Charge start time. [dischargeRegeneratedAh]
  * `157` - Number of Wh being regenerated between Discharge start time and Charge start time. [dischargeRegeneratedWh]
  * `159` - The maximum current during discharge. [dischargeCurrentMax]
  * `160` - Start datetime of charging in POSIX format, seconds since 1 Januari 1970 with local time offset [chargeTimeStart]
  * `161` - End datetime of charging in POSIX format, seconds since 1 Januari 1970 with local time offset [chargeTimeEnd]
  * `165` - Battery cell voltage, 60-90s before entering charge state. [chargeVpcStart]
  * `166` - Battery cell voltage, 60-90s before entering discharge state. [chargeVpcEnd]
  * `167` - Maximum voltage per cell during charge. [chargeVpcMax]
  * `168` - State of charge at start of charge. [chargeStateOfChargeStart]
  * `169` - State of charge at end of charge. [chargeStateOfChargeEnd]
  * `170` - Battery temperature at Charge start time. [chargeBatteryTemperatureStart]
  * `171` - Battery temperature at Charge end time. [chargeBatteryTemperatureEnd]
  * `172` - The maximum battery temperature being reached during charge. [chargeBatteryTemperatureMax]
  * `173` - The minimum battery temperature being reached during charge. [chargeBatteryTemperatureMin]
  * `174` - Ah charged between Charge start time and Charge end time. [chargeAh]
  * `175` - Wh charged between Charge start time and Charge end time. [chargeWh]
  * `176` - Ah charged when current > 25 % of capacity. [chargeAhI25]
  * `177` - Charge time when current > 25 % of capacity. [chargeTimeI25]
  * `178` - Ah charged when 25%  I > 15% of capacity. [chargeAhI15]
  * `179` - Charge time when 25%  I > 15 % of capacity. [chargeTimeI15]
  * `180` - Ah charged when 15%  I > 0% of capacity. [chargeAhI0]
  * `181` - Charge time when 15%  I > 0 % of capacity. [chargeTimeI0]
  * `182` - Total time in equalize charging phase. Only relevant if an Access battery charger is connected. [equalizeTime]
  * `183` - Ah being charged during equalize. Only relevant if an Access battery charger is used. [equalizeAh]
  * `184` - Wh being charged during equalize. Only relevant if an Access battery charger is used. [equalizeWh]
  * `186` - Maximum current measured during charge. [chargeCurrentMax]
  * `187` - Index of the history, event or instant log since start of operation. [index]
  * `220` - Array of device status [deviceStatus]
  * `24` - Current drained from the battery during charging. [baseLoad]
  * `25` - Resistance in the cables between charger and battery. [cableResistance]
  * `26` - Charging algorithm identifier. [algorithmNumber]
  * `5` - Number of cells of the battery [cells]
  * `50` - Calculated actual battery capacity. [actualCapacity]

The following are the data types, allowed ranges, and units for each ID mentioned in 'fields':
  * `127` [activeAlarms] - INT32[] [0 - 231]
  * `129` [algorithmName] - STRING [ - ]
  * `130` [algorithmVersion] - INT32 [0 - ]
  * `133` [dischargeTimeStart] - INT32 [0 - ]
  * `134` [dischargeTimeEnd] - INT32 [0 - ]
  * `138` [dischargeVpcStart] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in V)
  * `139` [dischargeVpcEnd] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in V)
  * `140` [dischargeVpcMin] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in V)
  * `141` [dischargeStateOfChargeStart] - INT32 [0 - ] (in %)
  * `142` [dischargeStateOfChargeEnd] - INT32 [0 - ] (in %)
  * `143` [dischargeBatteryTemperatureStart] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in C)
  * `144` [dischargeBatteryTemperatureEnd] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in C)
  * `145` [dischargeBatteryTemperatureMax] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in C)
  * `146` [dischargeBatteryTemperatureMin] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in C)
  * `147` [dischargeAh] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Ah)
  * `148` [dischargeWh] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Wh)
  * `149` [dischargeAhI25] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Ah)
  * `150` [dischargeTimeI25] - INT32 [0 - ] (in s)
  * `151` [dischargeAhI15] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Ah)
  * `152` [dischargeTimeI15] - INT32 [0 - ] (in s)
  * `153` [dischargeAhI0] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Ah)
  * `154` [dischargeTimeI0] - INT32 [0 - ] (in s)
  * `155` [dischargeRegeneratingTime] - INT32 [0 - ] (in s)
  * `156` [dischargeRegeneratedAh] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Ah)
  * `157` [dischargeRegeneratedWh] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Wh)
  * `159` [dischargeCurrentMax] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in A)
  * `160` [chargeTimeStart] - INT32 [0 - ] (in s)
  * `161` [chargeTimeEnd] - INT32 [0 - ] (in s)
  * `165` [chargeVpcStart] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in V)
  * `166` [chargeVpcEnd] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in V)
  * `167` [chargeVpcMax] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in V)
  * `168` [chargeStateOfChargeStart] - INT32 [0 - ] (in %)
  * `169` [chargeStateOfChargeEnd] - INT32 [0 - ] (in %)
  * `170` [chargeBatteryTemperatureStart] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in C)
  * `171` [chargeBatteryTemperatureEnd] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in C)
  * `172` [chargeBatteryTemperatureMax] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in C)
  * `173` [chargeBatteryTemperatureMin] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in C)
  * `174` [chargeAh] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Ah)
  * `175` [chargeWh] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Wh)
  * `176` [chargeAhI25] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Ah)
  * `177` [chargeTimeI25] - INT32 [0 - ] (in s)
  * `178` [chargeAhI15] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Ah)
  * `179` [chargeTimeI15] - INT32 [0 - ] (in s)
  * `180` [chargeAhI0] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Ah)
  * `181` [chargeTimeI0] - INT32 [0 - ] (in s)
  * `182` [equalizeTime] - INT32 [0 - ] (in s)
  * `183` [equalizeAh] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Ah)
  * `184` [equalizeWh] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Wh)
  * `186` [chargeCurrentMax] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in A)
  * `187` [index] - INT32 [0 - ]
  * `220` [deviceStatus] - INT32[] [0 - 74]
  * `24` [baseLoad] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in A)
  * `25` [cableResistance] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in )
  * `26` [algorithmNumber] - INT32 [0 - 65535]
  * `5` [cells] - INT32 [0 - ]
  * `50` [actualCapacity] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in Ah)

The order below can be changed as long as it follows the order of the rows. The list of allowed Device Data Specification IDs are:
  * `1` - Device numerical identification, configurable. [deviceID]
  * `10` - Unique device serial number [serialNumber]
  * `118` - Charged Ah in % of total capacity in main stage [chargeAhP]
  * `119` - Forklift ID [forkLiftId]
  * `120` - Battery serial number [batterySerialNumber]
  * `123` - The mode that charger will use to charge the battery [chargingMode]
  * `127` - Array of active alarm codes [activeAlarms]
  * `129` - The name of the charging algorithm [algorithmName]
  * `130` - The version of the charging algorithm, can be NULL [algorithmVersion]
  * `161` - End datetime of charging in POSIX format, seconds since 1 Januari 1970 with local time offset [chargeTimeEnd]
  * `165` - Battery cell voltage, 60-90s before entering charge state. [chargeVpcStart]
  * `166` - Battery cell voltage, 60-90s before entering discharge state. [chargeVpcEnd]
  * `174` - Ah charged between Charge start time and Charge end time. [chargeAh]
  * `175` - Wh charged between Charge start time and Charge end time. [chargeWh]
  * `182` - Total time in equalize charging phase. Only relevant if an Access battery charger is connected. [equalizeTime]
  * `183` - Ah being charged during equalize. Only relevant if an Access battery charger is used. [equalizeAh]
  * `184` - Wh being charged during equalize. Only relevant if an Access battery charger is used. [equalizeWh]
  * `187` - Index of the history, event or instant log since start of operation. [index]
  * `2` - Type of battery [batteryType]
  * `203` - Charger temperature when battery connected before start of charging. [chargerTemperatureStart]
  * `204` - Charger temperature when battery disconnected. [chargerTemperatureEnd]
  * `205` - Maximum charger temperature between charge start time and charge end time. [chargerTemperatureMax]
  * `207` - Event log index at start of charge [eventIndexStart]
  * `208` - Event log index at end of charge [eventIndexEnd]
  * `210` - Time when charger ouput power is turned on. [chargeTime]
  * `220` - Array of device status [deviceStatus]
  * `24` - Current drained from the battery during charging. [baseLoad]
  * `25` - Resistance in the cables between charger and battery. [cableResistance]
  * `26` - Charging algorithm identifier. [algorithmNumber]
  * `416` - Max power during charge. [LogPeakPower]
  * `417` - Consumed mains power. [LogConsumedKWh]
  * `5` - Number of cells of the battery [cells]
  * `50` - Calculated actual battery capacity. [actualCapacity]

The following are the data types, allowed ranges, and units for each ID mentioned in 'fields':
  * `1` [deviceID] - INT32 [0 - ]
  * `10` [serialNumber] - INT32 [ - ]
  * `118` [chargeAhP] - INT32 [0 - ] (in %)
  * `119` [forkLiftId] - INT32 [0 - ]
  * `120` [batterySerialNumber] - INT64 [0 - ]
  * `123` [chargingMode] - INT32 [0 - 4]
  * `127` [activeAlarms] - INT32[] [0 - 231]
  * `129` [algorithmName] - STRING [ - ]
  * `130` [algorithmVersion] - INT32 [0 - ]
  * `161` [chargeTimeEnd] - INT32 [0 - ] (in s)
  * `165` [chargeVpcStart] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in V)
  * `166` [chargeVpcEnd] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in V)
  * `174` [chargeAh] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Ah)
  * `175` [chargeWh] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Wh)
  * `182` [equalizeTime] - INT32 [0 - ] (in s)
  * `183` [equalizeAh] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Ah)
  * `184` [equalizeWh] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Wh)
  * `187` [index] - INT32 [0 - ]
  * `2` [batteryType] - INT32 [0 - 1]
  * `203` [chargerTemperatureStart] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in C)
  * `204` [chargerTemperatureEnd] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in C)
  * `205` [chargerTemperatureMax] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in C)
  * `207` [eventIndexStart] - INT32 [0 - ]
  * `208` [eventIndexEnd] - INT32 [0 - ]
  * `210` [chargeTime] - INT32 [0 - ] (in s)
  * `220` [deviceStatus] - INT32[] [0 - 74]
  * `24` [baseLoad] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in A)
  * `25` [cableResistance] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in )
  * `26` [algorithmNumber] - INT32 [0 - 65535]
  * `416` [LogPeakPower] - INT32 [0 - ] (in VA)
  * `417` [LogConsumedKWh] - INT32 [0 - ] (in kWh)
  * `5` [cells] - INT32 [0 - ]
  * `50` [actualCapacity] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in Ah)

51.description: The total remaining Ah available for the life time of the battery [ahLeft] (in Ah)

52.description: Days left until battery is considered as end of life. [timeLeft] (in Days)

53.description: Number of cycles where 25% or less of the battery capacity have been discharged. In order for the cycle to be counted at least 1Ah must have been discharged. [cycles2To25]

54.description: Number of cycles where 26-50% of the battery capacity have been discharged. In order for the cycle to be counted at least 1Ah must have been discharged. [cycles26To50]

55.description: Number of cycles where 51-80% of the battery capacity have been discharged. In order for the cycle to be counted at least 1Ah must have been discharged. [cycles51To80]

56.description: Number of cycles where 81-90% of the battery capacity have been discharged. In order for the cycle to be counted at least 1Ah must have been discharged. [cycles81To90]

57.description: Number of cycles where more than 90% of the battery capacity have been discharged. In order for the cycle to be counted at least 1Ah must have been discharged. [cyclesAbove90]

58.description: Number of charge cycles stopped before battery is fully charged. [StoppedCyles]

59.description: Cycles left in battery. Calculated as  Available cycles  Total cycle count. [cyclesLeft]

items.description:
The list of allowed Device Data Specification IDs are:
  * `187` - Index of the history, event or instant log since start of operation. [index]
  * `191` - The time when log was written [time]
  * `192` - Average current between two instant log samples.  [currentAverage]
  * `193` - Minimum current between two instant log samples. [currentMin]
  * `194` - Maximum current between two instant log samples. [currentMax]
  * `195` - Average battery voltage between two instant log samples.  [voltageAverage]
  * `196` - Minimum voltage between two instant log samples. [voltageMin]
  * `197` - Maximum voltage between two instant log samples. [voltageMax]
  * `198` - Average battery temperature between two instant log samples.  [temperatureAverage]
  * `199` - Minimum battery temperature between two instant log samples. [temperatureMin]
  * `200` - Maximum battery temperature between two instant log samples. [temperatureMax]
  * `201` - Average battery state of charge between two instant log samples (BMU2 only) [stateOfCharge]
  * `202` - Average center voltage between two instant log samples. [middleVoltageAverage]
  * `9` - The amount of seconds between instant logs, 0 = off [instantLogPeriod]

The following are the data types, allowed ranges, and units for each ID mentioned in 'fields':
  * `187` [index] - INT32 [0 - ]
  * `191` [time] - INT32 [0 - ] (in s)
  * `192` [currentAverage] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in A)
  * `193` [currentMin] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in A)
  * `194` [currentMax] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in A)
  * `195` [voltageAverage] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in V)
  * `196` [voltageMin] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in V)
  * `197` [voltageMax] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in V)
  * `198` [temperatureAverage] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in C)
  * `199` [temperatureMin] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in C)
  * `200` [temperatureMax] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in C)
  * `201` [stateOfCharge] - INT32 [0 - 100] (in %)
  * `202` [middleVoltageAverage] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in V)
  * `9` [instantLogPeriod] - INT32 [ - ]

The list of allowed Device Data Specification IDs are:
  * `127` - Array of active alarm codes [activeAlarms]
  * `187` - Index of the history, event or instant log since start of operation. [index]
  * `191` - The time when log was written [time]
  * `88` - Momentary charger heat sink temperature. [chargerTemperature]
  * `9` - The amount of seconds between instant logs, 0 = off [instantLogPeriod]
  * `90` - Momentary charger measured current. [chargerCurrent]
  * `91` - Momentary charger measured voltage. [chargerVoltage]

The following are the data types, allowed ranges, and units for each ID mentioned in 'fields':
  * `127` [activeAlarms] - INT32[] [0 - 231]
  * `187` [index] - INT32 [0 - ]
  * `191` [time] - INT32 [0 - ] (in s)
  * `88` [chargerTemperature] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in C)
  * `9` [instantLogPeriod] - INT32 [ - ]
  * `90` [chargerCurrent] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in A)
  * `91` [chargerVoltage] - DOUBLE [0 - ] (in V)

The list of allowed Device Data Specification IDs are:
  * `141` - State of charge at start of discharge. [dischargeSocStart]
  * `145` - The maximum battery temperature being reached during discharge. [dischargeBatteryTemperatureMax]
  * `146` - The minimum battery temperature being reached during discharge. [dischargeBatteryTemperatureMin]
  * `147` - Number of Ah discharged between discharge start time and charge start time. [dischargeAh]
  * `148` - Number of Wh discharged between discharge start time and charge start time. [dischargeWh]
  * `155` - Duration of current regeneration during discharge. [dischargeRegeneratingTime]
  * `156` - Number of Ah being regenerated between Discharge start time and Charge start time. [dischargeRegeneratedAh]
  * `157` - Number of Wh being regenerated between Discharge start time and Charge start time. [dischargeRegeneratedWh]
  * `162` - Time between Charge start time and Charge end time. [chargeTime]
  * `168` - State of charge at start of charge. [chargeSocStart]
  * `169` - State of charge at end of charge. [chargeSocEnd]
  * `172` - The maximum battery temperature being reached during charge. [chargeBatteryTemperatureMax]
  * `173` - The minimum battery temperature being reached during charge. [chargeBatteryTemperatureMin]
  * `174` - Ah charged between Charge start time and Charge end time. [chargeAh]
  * `175` - Wh charged between Charge start time and Charge end time. [chargeWh]
  * `187` - Index of the history, event or instant log since start of operation. [index]
  * `504` - Number of cycle logs written [cycleNr]
  * `505` - Time when battery was disconnected in ms [dischargeTimeStartMs]
  * `506` - Time when battery was disconnected in days [dischargeTimeStartDays]
  * `507` - Duration of discharge in minutes [dischargeTime]
  * `508` - Time when battery was connected in ms [chargeTimeStartMs]
  * `509` - Time when battery was connected in days [chargeTimeStartDays]
  * `510` - Bitcoded charge type  [chargeType]
  * `511` - Bitcoded error list [cycleError1]
  * `512` - Bitcoded error list [cycleError2]
  * `513` - Bitcoded error list [cycleError3]

The following are the data types, allowed ranges, and units for each ID mentioned in 'fields':
  * `141` [dischargeSocStart] - INT32 [0 - ] (in %)
  * `145` [dischargeBatteryTemperatureMax] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in C)
  * `146` [dischargeBatteryTemperatureMin] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in C)
  * `147` [dischargeAh] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Ah)
  * `148` [dischargeWh] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Wh)
  * `155` [dischargeRegeneratingTime] - INT32 [0 - ] (in s)
  * `156` [dischargeRegeneratedAh] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Ah)
  * `157` [dischargeRegeneratedWh] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Wh)
  * `162` [chargeTime] - INT32 [ - ]
  * `168` [chargeSocStart] - INT32 [0 - ] (in %)
  * `169` [chargeSocEnd] - INT32 [0 - ] (in %)
  * `172` [chargeBatteryTemperatureMax] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in C)
  * `173` [chargeBatteryTemperatureMin] - DOUBLE [ - ] (in C)
  * `174` [chargeAh] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Ah)
  * `175` [chargeWh] - INT32 [0 - ] (in Wh)
  * `187` [index] - INT32[] [0 - ]. ID 187 in this log is always an array of 2. The first element is the index when charging and the second one is the index when discharging.
  * `504` [cycleNr] - INT32[] [0 - ]. ID 504 in this log is always an array of 2. The first element is the cycle_Nr for charging and the second one is the cycle_Nr for discharging.
  * `505` [dischargeTimeStartMs] - INT32 [0 - ] (in ms)
  * `506` [dischargeTimeStartDays] - INT32 [0 - ] (in days)
  * `507` [dischargeTime] - INT32 [0 - ] (in min)
  * `508` [chargeTimeStartMs] - INT32 [0 - ] (in ms)
  * `509` [chargeTimeStartDays] - INT32 [0 - ] (in days)
  * `510` [chargeType] - INT32 [0 - 2]
  * `511` [cycleError1] - INT32 [ - ]. ID 511 in this log is always an array of 2. The first element is the cycleError1 when charging (null if no value) and the second one is the cycleError1 when discharging (null if no value).
  * `512` [cycleError2] - INT32 [ - ]. ID 512 in this log is always an array of 2. The first element is the cycleError2 when charging (null if no value) and the second one is the cycleError2 when discharging (null if no value).
  * `513` [cycleError3] - INT32 [ - ]. ID 513 in this log is always an array of 2. The first element is the cycleError3 when charging (null if no value) and the second one is the cycleError3 when discharging (null if no value).

The field must contain exactly these Device Data Specification IDs:
  * `187` - Index of the history, event or instant log since start of operation. [index]
  * `499` - Real time when log was written [timestamp]
  * `500` - Event type coded [bmsEventCode]

The following are the data types, allowed ranges, and units for each ID mentioned in 'fields':
  * `187` [index] - INT32 [0 - ]
  * `499` [timestamp] - INT32 [ - ]
  * `500` [bmsEventCode] - INT32 [ - ]

items.description:
The list of allowed Device Data Specification IDs are:
  * `187` - Index of the history, event or instant log since start of operation. [index]
  * `499` - Real time when log was written [timestamp]
  * `520` - Histogram of different variables measured in the BMS [bmsHistogram]
  * `521` - Type interpretation of histograms from BMS [bmsHistogramType]
  * `529` - BMS axis type [bmsAxisType]
  * `530` - BMS minimum [bmsMinimum]
  * `531` - BMS maximum [bmsMaximum]

The following are the data types, allowed ranges, and units for each ID mentioned in 'fields':
  * `187` [index] - INT32 [0 - ]
  * `499` [timestamp] - INT32 [ - ]
  * `520` [bmsHistogram] - INT32[] [ - ]
  * `521` [bmsHistogramType] - INT32[] [ - ]
  * `529` [bmsAxisType] - INT32 [ - ]
  * `530` [bmsMinimum] - INT32 [ - ]
  * `531` [bmsMaximum] - INT32 [ - ]
